name: FilmCrave
tag_list: movies, social-network, trailers, reviews, bootstrapped, lists, social-media, friends
overview:
FilmCrave is a niche social network targeted at movie lovers. It allows users to create organized top movie lists, write movie reviews, watch movie trailers, and provides basic social networking features.

Website specializes in user generated movie lists, new DVD releases 2011, new Blu-ray releases, and other forms of movie lists.

FilmCrave’s top competitor is Flixster.

FilmCrave’s partent company is ImaJAN Media (www.imajan.com) which also owns MeltedJoystick (www.meltedjoystick.com).

milestones.description: FilmCrave Partners with Hollywood.com to Power Social Network Ad Sales
milestones.source_text:
Kansas City, Missouri â€“ August, 2008 â€“ FilmCrave.com (www.filmcrave.com), an up-and-coming social network for movie fans, has partnered with the Hollywood.com Advertising Group (www.hollywood.com) to exclusively represent their online advertising sales.  The Hollywood.com Advertising Group, a leading entertainment vertical ad network, includes Hollywood.com, Movietickets.com, and other entertainment outlets encompassing nearly one hundred celebrity fan sites. 

With over fifteen years of advertising sales experience, the Hollywood.com Advertising Group offers entertainment-focused relationships with advertisers as well as a network of niche entertainment sites.  Now, with the avid FilmCrave.com movie fan base, advertisers will have a greater ability to supply targeted ads to reach the ultimate entertainment consumer.

â€œWe are very excited to sell ads for FilmCrave.com.  They have one of most innovative sites online.  We are proud to help generate revenue for their team,â€ says Kevin Davis, President and Chief Operating Officer of Hollywood.com. â€œWith FilmCrave.comâ€™s user geo-demographic information, the goal is to target individual tastes and information so that advertisers can best reach their target.â€

As a movie-based social network, FilmCrave.comâ€™s distinct advantage over general social media is its ability for advertisers to reach a niche member base and allow for deeper targetability based on subject matter.  In addition, FilmCrave.com does not rely on social applications or third party social networks to drive user interests but rather focuses on the core movie user experience.   

â€œWith Hollywood.comâ€™s partnership, FilmCrave.com will be the first social network in which advertisements actually enhance the website, rather than detract,â€ says Josh Collins, FilmCrave.com co-founder.  â€œBy creating ad zones based off more than just the areas on the site users visit, such as secure user data, ratings, and favorite genres, a user will be greeted with a unique experience that will not detract from the community.â€

With the ad sales team in place, FilmCrave is actively seeking investments from Venture Capitalists, Angel Investors, and potential partners.  As the up-and-coming movie social network to watch, FilmCrave.comâ€™s assets include unsurpassed web site usability, a customized feature set including their popular movie lists, incredible member loyalty, and now, online advertisements and branding to further enhance their service offering.

â€œHaving traveled this far without either funding or quality advertisements, itâ€™s nice to have solidified revenue generation,â€ notes Alex Olson, co-founder. â€œNow, weâ€™re focused on solidifying the investment.â€

About FilmCrave.com:

As a niche based social media site, they allow members to create organized top movie lists and write helpful movie reviews while at the same time integrating with social networking functions. Members are easily able to make friends by commenting on their profile, discussing their reviews, and browsing the latest member movie reviews and movie lists. The website is designed with both intuitive member usability and compliant adverting standards. FilmCrave is the perfect blend of user functionality and movie interaction. FilmCrave (owned and operated by ImaJAN Media, LLC) is privately-held and located in Lee's Summit, MO
